intro: Cratylia nutans, commonly known as the drooping burr legume, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive, pendulous flower clusters. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Cratylia nutans is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and thrives in warm, humid climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
